intro: Melampyrum nemorosum var. albanicum, commonly known as the Albanian touch-me-not, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist habitats such as woodlands and stream sides. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a slightly hairy surface. This variety is native to the Balkan Peninsula and is often found in rocky or forested areas.
